intro: Drimiopsis burkei, commonly known as the Cape drimiopsis, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, strap-shaped leaves and showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in spring or early summer. Drimiopsis burkei is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and resilience.
